ai-cnd5:68.1_0: As soon as they were chanted with some of the brahmins, some of the household to others, and some solid food, while they experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:
ai-cnd5:68.2_0: “Anything that has a beginning has an end.”
ai-cnd5:68.3_0: his mind was freed from defilements by not grasping.
ai-cnd5:68.4_0: They preparing perfection, but with their beards dressed in ocher robes, and wearing sandals. They walk too tall, hanging upholstered with joined palms, doing acts of respect toward the Buddha, offering them a bed, offering them water-boiling shed up and down, and round.
ai-cnd5:68.5_0: “Venerable Sir, you’re my teacher, I’m your disciple.”
ai-cnd5:68.6_0: First you’ve asked me for permission to live with not.
